alert.note: Alert for Kern (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 9:12PM PDT until August 21 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Kern County in central California... * Until midnight PDT tonight. * At 912 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Arvin, Tehachapi, Golden Hills, Stallion Springs, Keene, Bear Valley Springs, Water Canyon and Piutes. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
